title: Privacy Notices - Community Moderation System
scope: User-facing privacy notices per GDPR Art. 13/14 for all moderation processing operations

notices.title: Content Moderation and Reporting Privacy Notice
notices.deliveryContext: Displayed when user submits content report or receives moderation decision

processingPurposes: Process content reports to maintain platform safety and comply with Digital Services Act (DSA) Notice-and-Action requirements (Art. 16, 17)
Make moderation decisions to enforce community guidelines and legal requirements
Generate Statement of Reasons to inform users of moderation actions (DSA Art. 17)
Maintain audit trails for regulatory compliance and transparency reporting (DSA Art. 15, 24)
dataCategories: Your user ID and account information
Content you report or content reported about you (snapshot/hash at report time)
Your explanation and evidence for reports you submit
Your contact information (name and email, only when required by DSA for illegal content reports)
Moderation decisions affecting your content or account
Statement of Reasons provided to you
Audit trail metadata (timestamps, IP addresses for security)

legalBases.explanation: We are legally required to process content reports and moderation decisions under the EU Digital Services Act (Regulation 2022/2065), specifically Articles 16 (Notice-and-Action), 17 (Statement of Reasons), and 24 (Transparency Reporting).

We process moderation data to maintain a safe platform environment and protect users from harmful content. Our legitimate interests are: platform safety, user protection, and fraud prevention. We have balanced these interests against your privacy rights through data minimization (content hashes instead of full copies, limited reporter contact collection) and retention limits (12 months for reports, 30 days for personal data in decisions).

recipients: Internal content moderators (access to reports and content snapshots)
Supervisors (access to SLA monitoring and escalations)
Audit personnel (access to audit trails for compliance reporting)
European Commission DSA Transparency Database (redacted, anonymized Statement of Reasons with no personal data)
Certified Out-of-Court Dispute Settlement bodies (if you escalate your appeal per DSA Art. 21)
Law enforcement (only upon valid legal requests with documented basis)

transfersOutsideEEA.explanation: All moderation data is stored and processed within the European Economic Area (EEA). No transfers outside the EEA occur.

retentionPeriods.extensions: Extended for active investigations or legal proceedings; quarterly review of necessity
Extended for active appeals or legal proceedings; anonymized audit trail retained 7 years
Extended if escalated to Out-of-Court Dispute Settlement body

retentionPeriods.period: 7 years for legal defense and regulatory compliance
retentionPeriods.extensions: Personal data anonymized after 30 days; only aggregate metrics retained long-term

yourRights.explanation: You can request access to all your content reports, moderation decisions (with Statement of Reasons), and appeal history. We will provide a structured JSON export within 7 days.

You can request deletion of your personal data after retention periods expire. We cannot delete data required for legal compliance (DSA audit requirements) or legitimate interests (fraud prevention, legal defense) before retention periods end.
You can update your contact information. Immutable audit trails cannot be modified to ensure integrity.
You can download a structured export (JSON format) of your content reports and appeals.
You can object to automated profiling. You cannot object to processing required by legal obligation (DSA compliance).
You can request processing restriction during active appeals. Not applicable to legal obligation processing.
You can lodge a complaint with your national data protection authority if you believe we have violated your data protection rights.

automatedDecisionMaking.explanation: We use automated systems to classify content priority and detect policy violations. All moderation decisions are reviewed by human moderators. You have the right to contest automated classifications through our appeals process (DSA Art. 20).

contact.dataAccess: Use the 'Export My Data' feature in app settings or email data-access@growbro.app
contact.dataDeletion: Use the 'Delete My Account' feature in app settings or email data-deletion@growbro.app
contact.dpo: Contact our Data Protection Officer, Jan-Peter Blohm, at jan-blohm@gmx.de
contact.supervisoryAuthority: Contact your national data protection authority: https://edpb.europa.eu/about-edpb/about-edpb/members_en

notices.title: Age Verification Privacy Notice
notices.deliveryContext: Displayed before age verification process begins

processingPurposes: Verify you are over 18 years old to comply with Digital Services Act (DSA) minor protection requirements (Art. 28)
Enforce age-gating for age-restricted content to protect minors
Implement safer defaults for minor accounts (no profiling ads, restricted content visibility)
dataCategories: Age attribute (over-18 boolean only - we do NOT store your birthdate or ID documents)
One-time verification token (session-based, expires on logout)
Verification metadata (timestamp, IP address for fraud prevention only)

legalBases.explanation: We are legally required to verify user age under the EU Digital Services Act (Regulation 2022/2065), Article 28 (Protection of minors).

We process minimal age verification data to protect minors from age-inappropriate content. Our legitimate interests are: minor protection and content safety. We have designed a privacy-preserving system per EU Age-Verification Blueprint: we store only a boolean attribute (over-18), not your raw ID or birthdate.

privacyPreserving.noBirthdate: We do NOT store your birthdate. We only store whether you are over 18 (true/false).
privacyPreserving.noIDStorage: We do NOT store copies of your ID documents. Verification is one-time only.
privacyPreserving.reusableToken: After successful verification, you receive a reusable age token. You will not be asked to verify again unless you dispute your age.
privacyPreserving.noFingerprinting: We do NOT use device fingerprinting to enforce age verification without your explicit consent (ePrivacy Directive compliance).

recipients: Third-party age verification provider (one-time verification only; provider does NOT receive persistent data; EU Standard Contractual Clauses apply if processor outside EEA)

transfersOutsideEEA.explanation: Age verification data is stored within the European Economic Area (EEA). If our third-party age verification provider is outside the EEA, we use EU Standard Contractual Clauses to ensure adequate protection.

retentionPeriods.period: Session-based (expire on logout or session timeout)
retentionPeriods.extensions: None - tokens are deleted immediately upon session end

retentionPeriods.period: Valid until you dispute your age or delete your account
30 days after verification event (fraud prevention only)
retentionPeriods.extensions: Extended up to 90 days only for active fraud investigations with supervisor approval

yourRights.explanation: You can request your current age verification status and timestamp.
Your age attribute is deleted immediately when you delete your account. During active session, you cannot delete your age attribute without re-verification (required for age-gating enforcement).
If your age attribute is incorrect, you can request re-verification through app settings.
Minimal data is collected (boolean attribute only); included in your data export if requested.
You cannot object to age verification processing required by legal obligation (DSA Art. 28 compliance).
You can lodge a complaint with your national data protection authority if you believe we have violated your data protection rights.

automatedDecisionMaking.explanation: Age-gating is automatically enforced based on your verified age status. You can appeal age verification failures and provide alternative verification methods.

contact.reVerification: Use the 'Re-verify Age' feature in app settings
contact.dataAccess: Use the 'Export My Data' feature in app settings or email [data-access@growbro.app]
contact.dpo: Contact our Data Protection Officer at [data-protection@growbro.app]

notices.title: Geo-Location and Regional Restrictions Privacy Notice
notices.deliveryContext: Displayed in app privacy policy and when geo-blocking applied

processingPurposes: Detect your geographic location to enforce regional content restrictions and comply with local laws
Apply geo-blocking per moderation decisions (DSA Art. 17 Statement of Reasons includes territorial scope)
Prevent distribution of illegal content in jurisdictions where it is prohibited
dataCategories: IP address (for server-side geolocation; session-based only, NOT persistently stored)
GPS coordinates (ONLY if you explicitly consent; used for enhanced accuracy)
Derived country/region (cached for 1 hour for performance)

legalBases.explanation: We are legally required to enforce geo-blocking for certain content under regional laws and moderation decisions.

We process IP addresses to comply with regional laws and prevent illegal content distribution. Our legitimate interests are: legal compliance and regional content restrictions. IP geolocation does not require consent per ePrivacy Directive guidance (server-side processing, no terminal equipment access). We cache location decisions for 1 hour only (no long-term tracking).

GPS location processing requires your explicit consent per ePrivacy Directive Art. 5(3). We will ask for consent with a clear explanation of GPS usage (more accurate geo-blocking). You can deny consent and use IP-based location instead without losing platform access.

ipGeolocation.default: We use IP-based geolocation by default (no consent required per EDPB guidance).
ipGeolocation.accuracy: IP geolocation detects your country with >95% accuracy. It may be less accurate for specific cities.
ipGeolocation.sessionBased: Your IP address is used only for session-based geolocation. We do NOT persistently store your IP address.
ipGeolocation.noTracking: We do NOT track your location over time. Cached location decisions expire after 1 hour and are re-checked on app start.

gpsLocation.optional: GPS location is OPTIONAL. We will ask for your explicit consent before accessing GPS data.
gpsLocation.benefit: GPS provides more accurate geo-blocking (e.g., for city-specific restrictions).
gpsLocation.noStorage: We do NOT persistently store GPS coordinates. GPS data is processed in-memory only.
gpsLocation.withdrawable: You can withdraw GPS consent at any time via app settings. IP-based geolocation will be used instead.

content.noFingerprinting: We do NOT use device fingerprinting to detect location without your explicit consent (ePrivacy Directive Art. 5(3) compliance).
recipients: Content authors (notified when geo-restrictions applied to their content with affected regions)

transfersOutsideEEA.explanation: Location data is processed within the European Economic Area (EEA). No transfers outside the EEA occur.

retentionPeriods.extensions: None - IP addresses are not written to disk
None - GPS coordinates are never written to disk
None - cache eviction policy auto-expires after 1 hour

yourRights.explanation: You can request your current detected location and geo-blocking status via app settings.
Minimal persistent data (cached decisions expire automatically after 1 hour). No long-term location storage.
If location detection is incorrect, you can dispute it via our appeal process (manual review by moderators).
Minimal data (no persistent location storage); not applicable.
You can object to GPS tracking (withdraw consent). You cannot object to IP geolocation (required for legal compliance).
You can lodge a complaint with your national data protection authority if you believe we have violated your data protection rights.

automatedDecisionMaking.explanation: Geo-blocking is automatically applied based on detected location. You can appeal geo-blocking decisions via our appeal process (manual review with 'why can't I see this?' explainer).

contact.gpsConsent: Manage GPS consent via app settings (Privacy → Location)
contact.disputeLocation: Use the 'Appeal Geo-Block' feature or email [geo-appeals@growbro.app]
contact.dpo: Contact our Data Protection Officer at [data-protection@growbro.app]

notices.title: Moderator Privacy Notice
notices.deliveryContext: Displayed during moderator onboarding and in moderator console

processingPurposes: Track moderator actions for audit trail and compliance reporting (GDPR accountability, DSA transparency)
Monitor moderation quality and decision consistency
Assign reports and appeals with conflict-of-interest prevention
Generate performance analytics for training and quality improvement
dataCategories: Your moderator ID and account information
Reports and appeals assigned to you
Moderation decisions you make (action taken, reasoning, policy violations)
Performance metrics (handling time, appeal reversal rate, accuracy)
Access logs (timestamps, IP addresses for security)

legalBases.explanation: We are legally required to maintain audit trails for moderation actions under GDPR accountability principle (Art. 5(2)) and DSA transparency reporting (Art. 15, 24).

legalBases.basis: Legitimate interests (GDPR Art. 6(1)(f)) - if contractor/external moderator
legalBases.explanation: We process moderator performance data to ensure moderation quality and consistency. Our legitimate interests are: platform safety, user protection, and regulatory compliance. Your moderator ID is pseudonymized in public transparency reports (HMAC-SHA256 hash).
Processing moderator performance data is necessary to fulfill your employment/contractor agreement and provide required training and feedback.

recipients: Moderation supervisors (access to performance metrics and SLA monitoring)
Compliance and audit personnel (access to audit trails for regulatory reporting)
European Commission DSA Transparency Database (pseudonymized moderator IDs in redacted SoR submissions; no direct identifiers)

transfersOutsideEEA.explanation: All moderator data is stored and processed within the European Economic Area (EEA). No transfers outside the EEA occur.

retentionPeriods.period: 7 years for anonymized audit events; 30 days for moderator ID linkage
retentionPeriods.extensions: Moderator IDs pseudonymized after 30 days; only aggregate performance metrics retained long-term
Anonymized aggregate metrics retained indefinitely for quality trend analysis

yourRights.explanation: You can request access to all audit events involving your moderator actions and performance metrics.
Personal data is anonymized after 30 days (audit trail retention requirement). Full erasure honored 12 months after employment/contract end unless legal hold.
You can correct inaccurate moderator profile information. Immutable audit trails cannot be modified.
You can download a structured export of your moderator performance metrics.
You cannot object to processing required by legal obligation (GDPR accountability, DSA transparency). You can object to performance profiling not required for employment/contract.
You can lodge a complaint with your national data protection authority if you believe we have violated your data protection rights.

contact.dpo: Contact our Data Protection Officer at [data-protection@growbro.app]
